title: Trump says Iran executions stopped as Tehran postpones hanging of protester
subhead: In a surprise announcement on Wednesday, the US president said he had received assurances from 'very important sources on the other side' that executions in Iran would not go ahead. Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi later said there would be 'no hanging today or tomorrow,' in an interview with Fox News.

title: France to send troops to Greenland for joint exercise with several European countries
Zelensky to declare 'state of emergency' in Ukraine's energy sector
US suspends immigrant visa procedures for nationals of 75 countries
subhead: According to Fox News, the measure is set to affect citizens of Somalia, Russia, Afghanistan, Brazil, Iran, Iraq, Egypt, Nigeria, Thailand and Yemen, among others, but does not affect tourist, business or other visas.

title: South Korean prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law declaration
subhead: Prosecutors argued that the former conservative South Korean president was guilty of leading an insurrection 'in order to remain in power by usurping judicial and legislative authority.' The verdict is expected on February 19.

title: 'In the face of Donald Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
subhead: As the president shows his eagerness to dismantle any form of checks and balances both within and beyond the US borders, the principles of law paradoxically endure, explains Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: Astronauts from the Crew-11 space mission leave the ISS
50 French farmers arrested after storming agricultural ministry building in Paris
French Assemblée Nationale rejects no-confidence motions filed by LFI and RN in protest against free trade treaty
Venezuela's interim president announces 'new political era'
US-backed plan to end war in Gaza moves into second phase
Russia steps up Ukraine strikes as polar cold grips the country
Chiara Ferragni acquitted in charity cake and Easter egg fraud trial
Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie denounces Nigerian healthcare after baby son's death
EU says Ukraine will spend most of €90 billion loan on military needs
2025 ranks among the three hottest years ever recorded
Louvre's higher ticket prices for non-European visitors take effect
Corsican nationalist's assassination questions 'myth' of criminal code of honor
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

title: Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran's shah fanning the flames of revolt
subhead: The son of Iran's former monarch, driven out of the country by the 1979 Islamic Revolution, has repeatedly called for protests against the Tehran regime. Crowds chant his name, and from his US exile, he has increasingly positioned himself as a leader of the movement.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhead: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
'For her appeals trial, Marine Le Pen has made the shrewd choice to fight differently'
